properties.name: Annapolis Highland Vineyards
properties.description: Posted by Bearriverbot Brendan & Karen Enright 902 467 0363, karen.enright@ns.sympatico.ca Open May through October Hours M-F 10 – 5:30, Sat 10 – 5, Sun Noon – 5 We offer vineyard and winery tours, a retail & gift store with organic coffee, tea, iced tea, lemonade, and wine jelly, plus local artists’ work and giftware. Enjoy the seating area on our large deck. 2635 Clementsvale Road (2 kilometers east of Bear River)

properties.name: Barnwood Inn
properties.description: Posted by Bearriverbot   t. 467 0481 Delightful B&B located 5min from the picturesque Village of Bear River. This family run business offers a breathtaking view along with beautiful gardens and alpacas

properties.name: Bear River Bargain Books
properties.description: Posted by Bearriverbot Paul Volenik 902.467.0908 gpvolenik@gmail.com Open most days from 10-5. Winter by chance or appointment. Nestled in the heart of the village of Bear River, Bear River Bargains & Books is an overflowing cornucopia of second-hand and collectible books. Interspersed are mounds of old newspapers, magazines, prints, postcards, and ephemera, as well as other memorabilia and collectibles, including glassware, jewellery, records, antiques, furniture and items ranging from the usable to the bizarre!

properties.name: Bear River Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Bearriverbot  Hours Open at 11am, 7 days a week

properties.name: Bear River First Nations Heritage and Cultural Centre
properties.description: Posted by Bearriverbot    467 0325 Welcome! Pjila’si ! Let the beat of our Mi’kmaw drums awaken your soul. Ke’ mi’kmawey pepkwejeta’q tukwa’laj kjijaqmijl. Bear River First Nation Heritage and Cultural Centre Winner of the 2004 Tourism Industry Association of Nova Scotia (TIANS) Crystal Tourism Award of Excellence for Tourism Innovator Nestled in the forested hills of Bear River and among some of the most spectacular scenery in Nova Scotia, is the Bear River First Nation Heritage and Cultural Centre. The Centre interprets the heritage and culture of the Mi’kmaq of the Bear River area. Our people have always referred to ourselves as L’nuk, meaning “The People”. Today the word “Mi’kmaq” is the name used for our people.

properties.name: Flight of Fancy
properties.description: Posted by Bearriverbot  Open 9an - 6pm May 1st to October 31st The Flight of Fancy is an acclaimed art gallery and craft shop situated in the heart of Bear River. We offer a unique shopping experience at studio prices with something for everyone, from the work of over two hundred artists. Just follow the river to our door.

properties.name: Green Willow Studio
properties.description: Posted by Bearriverbot Flora’s acrylic and watercolour paintings are light filled and dance with brilliant colour. Larry is a metal and lapidary artist who uses fire and ancient ways to combine metal and gemstones for his one-of-a-kind pieces. Open year ’round by appointment or by chance. Green Willow Studio 967 Riverview Road, Bear River (902) 467-0553

properties.name: Myrtle and Rosie’s
properties.description: Posted by Bearriverbot  Noel & Diane Lalonde, 902 467 0146, myrtleandrosies@yahoo.com Ice Cream, Treats, and Treasures…we also feature Bear River-related memorabilia and fun things for the kids. Take home a tree orniment that will remind you of Bear River every Christmas. Try our own home-made Chili, sauces, take-out-meals, and especially Mom’s (really good) Bread Pudding! Located in the Trading Post Building.

properties.name: Quercia Nikitin Fibre Art
properties.description: Posted by Bearriverbot “Doing what I love in the creation of visual art and accessories shaped by my hands and conceived in my heart remains key to my artistic journey.” Jennifer creates etchings of plaster with acrylics and natural fibre sculptures as well as designing and fashioning felted purses, jewellery and clothing. Her mother, augments the collection by using her talent to produce unique and irresistible baby slippers and incredible felt sculptures. 362 Morganville Road, directly up Sissiboo Road, Left on Morganville Road to Barnes Lake…on the corner Also found at the Annapolis Farmers Market from May through October on Saturdays, The Flight of Fancy and Moorings Gallery www.quercianikitin.wordpress.com

properties.name: Spirit Getaways, Kelly Foxton
properties.description: Posted by Bearriverbot  “Spirit Getaways” with Kelly Foxton, Artist & Workshop Facilitator Spirit Getaways exists to facilitate the creative exploration of human potential through meaningful art and guided gentle-eco experiences. Eco-Art Programs for Children and Youth Art Classes Themed Weekend Getaways Creative Wellness Workshops & Day Retreats For registration information and to receive your Spirit Getaways workshop & retreat catalogue, visit Kelly in her studio (by chance or appointment) at 972 Riverview Road, Bear River, NS B0S1B0 telephone: 902-467-0466 email: spiritgetaways@yahoo.ca website: www.spiritgetaways.org

properties.name: Wild Rice Pottery
properties.description: Posted by Bearriverbot “From the Earth, To the Wheel, Through Fire…a Tradition” Stoneware, gas fired; clay and glazes mixed on the premises. Open Sunday to Friday, 9 am – 5 pm, year ’round. Saturday mornings at the Annapolis Royal Farmers’ and Traders’ Market. 714 Riverview Road, Bear River, NS B0S 1B0 (902) 467-3313 wildricepottery@eastlink.ca Exit 24 off Hwy 101 towards Bear River, + 5 km. Take the 4th road on the right (paved) and turn right at the intersection; 2nd house on the left.
